titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide that no person born in the United States be a United States citizen on account of birth in the United States unless a parent is a United States citizen at the time of the birth.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.
Joint Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on the Constitution and by the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 5/17/1995--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Limits citizenship at birth to persons born in the United States who have either a mother or father who is a U.S. citizen.
